error.signature:
fatal error: all goroutines are asleep - deadlock!

goroutine 1 [chan send]:
main.main()
	/app/main.go:10 +0x40

verdict.summary: Go 1.22+ runtime detected that all goroutines are blocked on channel operations. Typically caused by sending on an unbuffered channel with no receiver, or forgetting to close a channel that a range loop reads from.

dead_ends.why_fails: Buffered channels only delay the deadlock until the buffer fills — the fundamental send/receive imbalance remains
Sleep does not create a receiver — the goroutine still blocks after the sleep completes

workarounds.action: Launch channel operations in separate goroutines to ensure send and receive are concurrent
Use sync.WaitGroup with close(ch) to signal channel completion

leads_to.condition: when deadlock is 'fixed' by adding goroutines that then leak

preceded_by.condition: when fixing races by adding channels introduces deadlocks

frequently_confused_with.distinction: Deadlock is detected by the runtime when ALL goroutines are blocked and the program crashes, while goroutine leaks are silent — some goroutines are blocked but others continue running.
